hints.text: Hello world!
Is there anyone?
It looks like we can communicate
Can you tell me if you are here?
SOS
I feel alone
Thank god!
So glad to see I'm not alone!
I’m in a closed room with a screen, a chat and a door
Appartently, you can help me
To be honest, I don’t really like this place and I don’t want to discover what will happen when the timer is done
Oh, have you seen the URL of the page?
Have you tried to change 1 by 2 in the URL?
I don't think you've changed the URL
Oh, the door just opened!
Have you done anything?
If yes, thanks a lot!
Oh no, the second room looks the same: another door and another screen with Inspector Gadget
Inspector Gadget... maybe we should inspect the screen in a different way
Maybe you can right click on the picture and select 'Inspect'
If I remember well, images have a alt tag in HTML
Yeah, the door opens!
And there is another room
What is Maxence's favorite drink?
Not so many information, maybe we should change the URL again
Oh Chartreuse, I've heard about it!
It's a French liquor
55%, really strong drink
Any way, we have to solve this problem again
Chartreuse has probably another meaning
This is annoying
I'm really fed up with this room
The Chartreuse colour is too much for me
Really, was there no other colours in the world to choose from?!
My brain is full of carrots and 42s!!
You need to help me out here. Select the expressions that would be true
So colors have names as well as hexadecimal and rgb values. Interesting...
What's this riddle's about?
Is it about strings or numbers?
Seems like it's about both, but the input should clearly be a string.
Hmmm... What happens when you concatenate a string and a number?
Could it be that the answer is... my favorite fruit?
Try typing in 'banana'.
My my that that was really cryptic
What have we here...?
I see a bridge and it appears the meaning of life is on both sides of it
Do you see it?
Okay good, it appears I can't cross it though. There are massive sections missing.
Any ideas?
Hmm, not sure if this helps but the bridge is called 'The Bridge of Truth'
I guess it's something to do with comparative operators
I've always wondered why NaN === NaN is false...
Let's see what's this one's about...
The form seems broken...
When there is no action to a form, it takes the current url as the value.
But what about the method...?
Should a form send a get request? That sounds wierd.
Try changing the form method to post in the dev tools elements tab.
Those developer tools are really handy!
What have we here?
This seems like a tricky one. What does the title mean?
Is the flag enough?
How can we see the code itself?
The solution should add a button that'll take us to the next room, but can any flag button append the solution button?
Read the script tag in the elements tab of the dev tools and find the right button to append the solution button.
Cool to know that we can read script tags and understand what's happening in a page.
Seems like these riddles never end... Will we make it in time?
This new room with Robin Hood looks like a math problem
If we use 4 arrows, I think we can reach 87 points
1*12 + 2*17 + 1*41 = 87... I've found a solution!
Another math problem...
Arg, this problem is tough
I've found a solution!
Numbers, again...
It seems to be coordinates
We can write 4 characters and we have 4 coordinates...
Each coordinates represents a city. What about taking the first letter of each city?
